reasoning: Portal hypertension is a complication secondary to liver cirrhosis and portal vein thrombosis, reported as prevalence rather than incidence. Global prevalence estimated at ~10,500 per 100k based on cirrhosis epidemiology (2-3% cirrhosis prevalence globally Ã— 50-60% develop portal hypertension). High geographic variation reflects hepatitis B/C and alcohol consumption patterns.
source: Bosch J et al. (2004). Portal hypertension. The Lancet. 362(9391):1440-1447; WHO estimates of cirrhosis prevalence (2000-2005)
